name: ec
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing ElasticCloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`ec` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/elastic/terraform-provider-ec).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing ElasticCloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/elastic/terraform-provider-ec)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-ec` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-ec/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-ec` repo](https://github.com/elastic/terraform-provider-ec/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/elastic/terraform-provider-ec)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-ec` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-ec/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-ec` repo](https://github.com/elastic/terraform-provider-ec/issues).

apikey.description: API Key to use for API authentication. The only valid authentication mechanism for the Elasticsearch Service.

insecure.description: Allow the provider to skip TLS validation on its outgoing HTTP calls.

password.description:
Password to use for API authentication. Available only when targeting ECE Installations or Elasticsearch Service
Private.

timeout.description: Timeout used for individual HTTP calls. Defaults to "1m".

username.description:
Username to use for API authentication. Available only when targeting ECE Installations or Elasticsearch Service
Private.

verbose.description: When set, a "request.log" file will be written with all outgoing HTTP requests. Defaults to "false".

verboseCredentials.description: When set with verbose, the contents of the Authorization header will not be redacted. Defaults to "false".

verboseFile.description: Timeout used for individual HTTP calls. Defaults to "1m".

config.description: Optionally define the Apm configuration options for the APM Server

debugEnabled.description: Optionally enable debug mode for APM servers - defaults to false

dockerImage.description: Optionally override the docker image the APM nodes will use. This option will not work in ESS customers and should only be changed if you know what you're doing.

userSettingsJson.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*yaml' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user*settings*whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user*settings*blacklist'). (This field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

userSettingsOverrideJson.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*override*yaml' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system*settings'. (This field together with 'system*settings' and 'user*settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

userSettingsOverrideYaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*override*json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system*settings'. (This field together with 'system*settings' and 'user*settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

userSettingsYaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*json' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user*settings*whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user*settings*blacklist'). (These field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

autoscale.description: Enable or disable autoscaling. Defaults to the setting coming from the deployment template.

cloudId.description: The encoded Elasticsearch credentials to use in Beats or Logstash

config.description: Elasticsearch settings which will be applied to all topologies

extensions.description: Optional Elasticsearch extensions such as custom bundles or plugins.

keystoreContents.description: Keystore contents that are controlled by the deployment resource.

refId.description: A human readable reference for the Elasticsearch resource. The default value `main-elasticsearch` is recommended.

region.description: The Elasticsearch resource region

remoteClusters.description: Optional Elasticsearch remote clusters to configure for the Elasticsearch resource, can be set multiple times

snapshot.description: (ECE only) Snapshot configuration settings for an Elasticsearch cluster.

strategy.description: Configuration strategy type autodetect, grow_and_shrink, rolling_grow_and_shrink, rolling_all

autoscaling.description: Optional Elasticsearch autoscaling settings, such a maximum and minimum size and resources.

instanceConfigurationId.description: Computed Instance Configuration ID of the topology element

nodeRoles.description: The computed list of node roles for the current topology element

nodeTypeData.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (data node)

nodeTypeIngest.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (ingest node)

nodeTypeMaster.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (master node)

nodeTypeMl.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (machine learning node)

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" per node in the "<size in GB>g" notation

zoneCount.description: Number of zones that the Elasticsearch cluster will span. This is used to set HA

maxSize.description: Maximum size value for the maximum autoscaling setting.

maxSizeResource.description: Maximum resource type for the maximum autoscaling setting.

minSize.description: Minimum size value for the minimum autoscaling setting.

minSizeResource.description: Minimum resource type for the minimum autoscaling setting.

policyOverrideJson.description: Computed policy overrides set directly via the API or other clients.

dockerImage.description: Optionally override the docker image the APM nodes will use. This option will not work in ESS customers and should only be changed if you know what you're doing.

plugins.description: List of Elasticsearch supported plugins, which vary from version to version. Check the Stack Pack version to see which plugins are supported for each version. This is currently only available from the UI and [ecctl](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/ecctl/master/ecctl_stack_list.html)

userSettingsJson.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*yaml' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user*settings*whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user*settings*blacklist'). (This field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

userSettingsOverrideJson.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*override*yaml' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system*settings'. (This field together with 'system*settings' and 'user*settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

userSettingsOverrideYaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*override*json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system*settings'. (This field together with 'system*settings' and 'user*settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

userSettingsYaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user*settings*json' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user*settings*whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user*settings*blacklist'). (These field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

type.description: Extension type, only `bundle` or `plugin` are supported.

url.description: Bundle or plugin URL, the extension URL can be obtained from the `ec_deployment_extension.<name>.url` attribute or the API and cannot be a random HTTP address that is hosted elsewhere.

version.description: Elasticsearch compatibility version. Bundles should specify major or minor versions with wildcards, such as `7.*` or `*` but **plugins must use full version notation down to the patch level**, such as `7.10.1` and wildcards are not allowed.

alias.description: Alias for this Cross Cluster Search binding

refId.description: Remote elasticsearch "ref_id", it is best left to the default value

skipUnavailable.description: If true, skip the cluster during search when disconnected

reference.description: Cluster snapshot reference repository settings, containing the repository name in ECE fashion

repositoryName.description: ECE snapshot repository name, from the '/platform/configuration/snapshots/repositories' endpoint

snapshotName.description: Name of the snapshot to restore. Use '**latest_success**' to get the most recent successful snapshot.

sourceElasticsearchClusterId.description: ID of the Elasticsearch cluster that will be used as the source of the snapshot

trustAll.description: If true, all clusters in this account will by default be trusted and the `trust_allowlist` is ignored.

trustAllowlists.description: The list of clusters to trust. Only used when `trust_all` is false.

relationshipId.description: The ID of the external trust relationship.

trustAll.description: If true, all clusters in this account will by default be trusted and the `trust_allowlist` is ignored.

trustAllowlists.description: The list of clusters to trust. Only used when `trust_all` is false.

(This field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'system*settings' and 'user*settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

(These field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

config.description: Optionally define the Integrations Server configuration options for the IntegrationsServer Server

endpoints.description: URLs for the accessing the Fleet and APM API's within this Integrations Server resource.

(This field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

(These field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'user*settings*override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

azureEndpointGuid.description: Azure endpoint GUID. Only applicable when the ruleset type is set to `azure_private_endpoint`

azureEndpointName.description: Azure endpoint name. Only applicable when the ruleset type is set to `azure_private_endpoint`

source.description: Traffic filter source: IP address, CIDR mask, or VPC endpoint ID, **only required** when the type is not `azure_private_endpoint`

settings.description: An arbitrary JSON object containing the repository settings.

accessKey.description: An S3 access key. If set, the secret_key setting must also be specified. If unset, the client will use the instance or container role instead.

bucket.description: Name of the S3 bucket to use for snapshots.

endpoint.description: The S3 service endpoint to connect to. This defaults to s3.amazonaws.com but the AWS documentation lists alternative S3 endpoints. If you are using an S3-compatible service then you should set this to the service’s endpoint.

pathStyleAccess.description: Whether to force the use of the path style access pattern. If true, the path style access pattern will be used. If false, the access pattern will be automatically determined by the AWS Java SDK (See AWS documentation for details). Defaults to false.

region.description: Allows specifying the signing region to use. Specifying this setting manually should not be necessary for most use cases. Generally, the SDK will correctly guess the signing region to use. It should be considered an expert level setting to support S3-compatible APIs that require v4 signatures and use a region other than the default us-east-1. Defaults to empty string which means that the SDK will try to automatically determine the correct signing region.

secretKey.description: An S3 secret key. If set, the access_key setting must also be specified.

serverSideEncryption.description: When set to true files are encrypted on server side using AES256 algorithm. Defaults to false.

elasticsearchClusterRefId.description: The locally-unique user-specified id of an APM Resource.

httpEndpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the APM resource.

httpsEndpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the APM resource.

refId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this APM resource.

instanceConfigurationId.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zoneCount.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

autoscale.description: Whether or not Elasticsearch autoscaling is enabled.

cloudId.description: The cloud ID, an encoded string that provides other Elastic services with the necessary information to connect to this Elasticsearch and Kibana. See [Configure Beats and Logstash with Cloud ID](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-cloud-id.html) for more information.

httpEndpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the Elasticsearch resource.

httpsEndpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the Elasticsearch resource.

refId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Elasticsearch cluster.

autoscalings.description: Optional Elasticsearch autoscaling settings, such a maximum and minimum size and resources.

instanceConfigurationId.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

nodeRoles.description: Defines the list of Elasticsearch node roles assigned to the topology element. This is supported from v7.10, and required from v8.

nodeTypeData.description: Defines whether this node can hold data (\n\n).

nodeTypeIngest.description: Defines whether this node can run an ingest pipeline (\n\n).

nodeTypeMaster.description: Defines whether this node can be elected master (\n\n).

nodeTypeMl.description: Defines whether this node can run ML jobs (\n\n).

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zoneCount.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

maxSize.description: Maximum size the tier can scale up to, e.g "64g".

maxSizeResource.description: Resource type used when specifying the maximum size the tier can scale up to.

minSize.description: Minimum size the tier can scale down to when bidirectional autoscaling is supported.

minSizeResource.description: Resource type used when specifying the minimum size the tier can scale down to when bidirectional autoscaling is supported.

policyOverrideJson.description: An arbitrary JSON object overriding the default autoscaling policy. Don't set unless you really know what you are doing.

elasticsearchClusterRefId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for an Elasticsearch resource in this deployment.

httpEndpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the Enterprise Search resource.

httpsEndpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the Enterprise Search resource.

refId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Enterprise Search resource.

status.description: Enterprise Search resource status (for example, "started", "stopped", etc).

instanceConfigurationId.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

nodeTypeAppserver.description: Defines whether this instance should run as application/API server.

nodeTypeConnector.description: Defines whether this instance should run as connector.

nodeTypeWorker.description: Defines whether this instance should run as background worker.

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zoneCount.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

elasticsearchClusterRefId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for an Elasticsearch resource in this deployment.

httpEndpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the resource kind.

httpsEndpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the resource kind.

refId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Integrations Server resource.

instanceConfigurationId.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zoneCount.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

elasticsearchClusterRefId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for an Elasticsearch resource in this deployment.

httpEndpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the Kibana resource.

httpsEndpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the Kibana resource.

refId.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Kibana resource.

instanceConfigurationId.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zoneCount.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

deploymentId.description: Destination deployment ID for the shipped logs and monitoring metrics.

logs.description: Defines whether logs are shipped to the destination deployment.

metrics.description: Defines whether metrics are shipped to the destination deployment.

refId.description: Elasticsearch resource kind ref_id of the destination deployment.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

enterpriseSearchResourceId.description: The Enterprise Search resource unique ID.

integrationsServerResourceId.description: The Integrations Server resource unique ID.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

compatibleNodeTypes.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylists.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

dockerImage.description: Docker image to use for the APM instance.

compatibleNodeTypes.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylists.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

dockerImage.description: Docker image to use for the Elasticsearch cluster instances.

plugins.description: List of available plugins to be specified by users in Elasticsearch cluster instances.

compatibleNodeTypes.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylists.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

dockerImage.description: Docker image to use for the Enterprise Search instance.

compatibleNodeTypes.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylists.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

dockerImage.description: Docker image to use for the Kibana instance.

includeByDefault.description: Should the ruleset be automatically included in the new deployments.

region.description: The ruleset can be attached only to deployments in the specific region.

source.description: Allowed traffic filter source: IP address, CIDR mask, or VPC endpoint ID.

provider.description:
The provider type for the ec package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apikey.description: API Key to use for API authentication. The only valid authentication mechanism for the Elasticsearch Service.

endpoint.description: Endpoint where the terraform provider will point to. Defaults to "https://api.elastic-cloud.com".

insecure.description: Allow the provider to skip TLS validation on its outgoing HTTP calls.

password.description:
Password to use for API authentication. Available only when targeting ECE Installations or Elasticsearch Service
Private.

timeout.description: Timeout used for individual HTTP calls. Defaults to "1m".

username.description:
Username to use for API authentication. Available only when targeting ECE Installations or Elasticsearch Service
Private.

verbose.description: When set, a "request.log" file will be written with all outgoing HTTP requests. Defaults to "false".

verboseCredentials.description: When set with verbose, the contents of the Authorization header will not be redacted. Defaults to "false".

verboseFile.description: Timeout used for individual HTTP calls. Defaults to "1m".

apikey.description: API Key to use for API authentication. The only valid authentication mechanism for the Elasticsearch Service.

Private.

alias.description: Alias for this Cross Cluster Search binding

apm.description: **DEPRECATED** APM cluster definition. This should only be used for deployments running a version lower than 8.0

deploymentTemplateId.description: Deployment template identifier to create the deployment from. See the [full list](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-regions-templates-instances.html) of regions and deployment templates available in ESS.

elasticsearchPassword.description: Password for authenticating to the Elasticsearch resource. ~> **Note on deployment credentials** The elastic user credentials are only available whilst creating a deployment. Importing a deployment will not import the elasticsearch_username or elasticsearch_password attributes.

elasticsearchUsername.description: Username for authenticating to the Elasticsearch resource.

integrationsServer.description: Integrations Server cluster definition. Integrations Server replaces `apm` in Stack versions > 8.0

kibana.description:
Kibana cluster definition. -> **Note on disabling Kibana** While optional it is recommended deployments specify a Kibana
block, since not doing so might cause issues when modifying or upgrading the deployment.

observability.description:
Observability settings that you can set to ship logs and metrics to a deployment. The target deployment can also be the
current deployment itself by setting observability.deployment_id to `self`.

region.description:
Elasticsearch Service (ESS) region where the deployment should be hosted. For Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE)
installations, set to `"ece-region".

requestId.description:
Request ID to set when you create the deployment. Use it only when previous attempts return an error and `request_id` is
returned as part of the error.

resetElasticsearchPassword.description: Explicitly resets the elasticsearch_password when true

trafficFilters.description: List of traffic filters rule identifiers that will be applied to the deployment.

version.description: Elasticsearch compatibility version. Bundles should specify major or minor versions with wildcards, such as `7.*` or `*` but **plugins must use full version notation down to the patch level**, such as `7.10.1` and wildcards are not allowed.

asFile.description: Indicates the the remote keystore setting should be stored as a file. The default is false, which stores the keystore setting as string when value is a plain string.

deploymentId.description: Deployment ID of the Deployment that holds the Elasticsearch cluster where the keystore setting will be written to.

settingName.description: Name for the keystore setting, if the setting already exists in the Elasticsearch cluster, it will be overridden.

value.description: Value of this setting. This can either be a string or a JSON object that is stored as a JSON string in the keystore.

downloadUrl.description: The URL to download the extension archive.

extensionType.description: Extension type. Must be `bundle` or `plugin`. A `bundle` will usually contain a dictionary or script, where a `plugin` is compiled from source.

fileHash.description: Hash value of the file. Triggers re-uploading the file on change.

filePath.description: Local file path to upload as the extension.

lastModified.description: The datatime the extension was last modified.

size.description: The size of the extension file in bytes.

url.description: The extension URL which will be used in the Elastic Cloud deployment plan.

version.description: Elastic stack version. A full version (e.g 8.7.0) should be set for plugins. A wildcard (e.g 8.*) may be used for bundles.

includeByDefault.description: Indicates that the ruleset should be automatically included in new deployments (Defaults to false)

type.description: Type of the ruleset. It can be `ip`, `vpce`, `azure_private_endpoint`, or `gcp_private_service_connect_endpoint`

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getGcpPrivateServiceConnectEndpoint.

region.description: Region to retrieve the Prive Link configuration for.

domainName.description: The domain name to point towards the PSC endpoint.

serviceAttachmentUri.description: The service attachment URI to attach the PSC endpoint to.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getStack.

lock.description: Lock the `latest` `version_regex` obtained, so that the new stack release doesn't cascade the changes down to the deployments. It can be changed at any time.

region.description: Region where the stack pack is. For Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE) installations, use `ece-region`.

versionRegex.description: Regex to filter the available stacks. Can be any valid regex expression, when multiple stacks are matched through a regex, the latest version is returned. `latest` is also accepted to obtain the latest available stack version.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getStack.

accessible.description: To have this version accessible/not accessible by the calling user. This is only relevant for Elasticsearch Service (ESS), not for ECE.

allowlisted.description: To include/not include this version in the `allowlist`. This is only relevant for Elasticsearch Service (ESS), not for ECE.

apms.description: Information for APM workloads on this stack version.

elasticsearches.description: Information for Elasticsearch workloads on this stack version.

enterpriseSearches.description: Information for Enterprise Search workloads on this stack version.

id.description: Unique identifier of this data source.

kibanas.description: Information for Kibana workloads on this stack version.

lock.description: Lock the `latest` `version_regex` obtained, so that the new stack release doesn't cascade the changes down to the deployments. It can be changed at any time.

minUpgradableFrom.description: The minimum stack version which can be upgraded to this stack version.

region.description: Region where the stack pack is. For Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE) installations, use `ece-region`.

upgradableTos.description: A list of stack versions which this stack version can be upgraded to.

versionRegex.description: Regex to filter the available stacks. Can be any valid regex expression, when multiple stacks are matched through a regex, the latest version is returned. `latest` is also accepted to obtain the latest available stack version.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTrafficFilter.

region.description: The ruleset can be attached only to deployments in the specific region.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTrafficFilter.

id.description: The id of the traffic filter to select.

name.description: The exact name of the traffic filter to select.

region.description: Region where the traffic filter is. For Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE) installations, use `ece-region`
